channel.title: INfinance
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INfinance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: ‘My strategy may be flawed’: Will I lose out on $500,000 SIPC insurance coverage if I only have one investment account?
item.description: “As a retiree, I set up multiple accounts at the same firm.”

item.title: ‘I take pride in being debt-free’: My husband owes thousands of dollars in student loans and credit-card debt. Will I be on the hook if he dies?
item.description: “We own a house together through a joint trust, but our bank accounts and credit cards are all held separately.”

item.title: Trump’s tariffs are the opening rounds of Trade War II
item.description: Trade’s importance to America’s security and global standing shouldn’t be underestimated.

item.title: Your home insurance costs more in high-risk areas. Your mortgage should, too.
item.description: Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac don’t factor climate change into rates. More frequent floods, hurricanes and wildfires raise systemic default risk.

item.title: Metal Prices Fall; Copper Risks Have Grown but Aluminum Prices Could Climb
item.description: Metal prices fell, with LME three-month copper down 0.5% and LME three-month aluminum down 0.6%.

item.title: U.S. Natural Gas Futures Rise
item.description: U.S. natural gas prices rose as cold temperatures sweep across the Midwest toward the Northeast. For the European gas market, ING expects prices to tr...

item.title: If Trump axes this golden ticket for immigrants, tech stocks and U.S. jobs could suffer
item.description: An end to legal skilled immigration — particularly the H-1B visa program — would cause a brain drain in the U.S. and weaken its economy.

item.title: U.S. Crude Oil Stocks Fall as Lower Imports Offset Higher Output
item.description: U.S. crude-oil inventories fell for a third consecutive week as imports declined, offsetting a rise in domestic production to a record level.

item.title: Nasdaq Crosses 20,000; Inflation Data Boosts Rate-Cut Hopes
item.description: The Nasdaq Composite crossed 20,000 for the first time, lifted by the AI rally and new inflation data that bolstered expectations the Federal Reserve ...

item.title: Oil Extends Gains After U.S. Crude Stocks Draw
item.description: Oil prices continued to rise after U.S. crude inventories fell for a third consecutive week.
